project.name: pixi.js
project.description: Pixi.js is a fast lightweight 2D library that works across all devices.

Circle.description: The Circle object can be used to specify a hit area for displayObjects

params.name: x

params.name: y

params.description: The radius of the circle

Ellipse.description: The Ellipse object can be used to specify a hit area for displayObjects

params.name: y

Matrix.name: Matrix
Matrix.description:
The Matrix class is now an object, which makes it a lot faster, 
here is a representation of it : 
| a | b | tx|
| c | d | ty|
| 0 | 0 | 1 |

Matrix2.name: Matrix2
Matrix2.description:
The Matrix2 class will choose the best type of array to use between
a regular javascript Array and a Float32Array if the latter is available

Point.name: Point
Point.description: The Point object represents a location in a two-dimensional coordinate system, where x represents the horizontal axis and y represents the vertical axis.

params.name: x
params.description: position of the point on the x axis

params.name: y
params.description: position of the point on the y axis

params.name: points
params.description:
This can be an array of Points that form the polygon,
     a flat array of numbers that will be interpreted as [x,y, x,y, ...], or the arguments passed can be
     all the points of the polygon e.g. `new PIXI.Polygon(new PIXI.Point(), new PIXI.Point(), ...)`, or the
     arguments passed can be flat x,y values e.g. `new PIXI.Polygon(x,y, x,y, x,y, ...)` where `x` and `y` are
     Numbers.

Rectangle.name: Rectangle
Rectangle.description: the Rectangle object is an area defined by its position, as indicated by its top-left corner point (x, y) and by its width and its height.

params.name: x
params.description: The X coord of the upper-left corner of the rectangle

params.name: y
params.description: The Y coord of the upper-left corner of the rectangle

params.name: width
params.description: The overall width of this rectangle

params.name: height
params.description: The overall height of this rectangle

DisplayObject.name: DisplayObject
DisplayObject.description:
The base class for all objects that are rendered on the screen. 
This is an abstract class and should not be used on its own rather it should be extended.

DisplayObjectContainer.name: DisplayObjectContainer
DisplayObjectContainer.description:
A DisplayObjectContainer represents a collection of display objects.
It is the base class of all display objects that act as a container for other objects.

MovieClip.name: MovieClip
MovieClip.description: A MovieClip is a simple way to display an animation depicted by a list of textures.

params.name: textures
params.description: an array of {Texture} objects that make up the animation

Sprite.name: Sprite
Sprite.description: The Sprite object is the base for all textured objects that are rendered to the screen

params.name: texture

SpriteBatch.name: SpriteBatch

Stage.name: Stage
Stage.description: A Stage represents the root of the display tree. Everything connected to the stage is rendered

params.name: backgroundColor
params.description:
the background color of the stage, you have to pass this in is in hex format
     like: 0xFFFFFF for white

Creating a stage is a mandatory process when you use Pixi, which is as simple as this : 
var stage = new PIXI.Stage(0xFFFFFF);
where the parameter given is the background colour of the stage, in hex
you will use this stage instance to add your sprites to it and therefore to the renderer
Here is how to add a sprite to the stage : 
stage.addChild(sprite);

params.name: texture
params.description: The texture to use

Spine.name: Spine
Spine.description:
The Spine loader is used to load in JSON spine data
To generate the data you need to use http://esotericsoftware.com/ and export in the "JSON" format
Due to a clash of names  You will need to change the extension of the spine file from *.json to *.anim for it to load
See example 12 (http://www.goodboydigital.com/pixijs/examples/12/) to see a working example and check out the source
You will need to generate a sprite sheet to accompany the spine data
When loaded this class will dispatch a "loaded" event

params.name: url
params.description: The url of the spine anim file to be used

params.name: texture
params.description: The texture to use

params.name: width
params.description: the width

params.name: height
params.description: the height

TilingSprite.name: TilingSprite
TilingSprite.description: A tiling sprite is a fast way of rendering a tiling image

params.name: texture
params.description: the texture of the tiling sprite

params.name: width
params.description: the width of the tiling sprite

params.name: height
params.description: the height of the tiling sprite

AbstractFilter.name: AbstractFilter
AbstractFilter.description:
This is the base class for creating a pixi.js filter. Currently only webGL supports filters.
If you want to make a custom filter this should be your base class.

AlphaMaskFilter.name: AlphaMaskFilter
AlphaMaskFilter.description:
The AlphaMaskFilter class uses the pixel values from the specified texture (called the displacement map) to perform a displacement of an object.
 You can use this filter to apply all manor of crazy warping effects
 Currently the r property of the texture is used to offset the x and the g propery of the texture is used to offset the y.

params.name: texture
params.description: The texture used for the displacemtent map * must be power of 2 texture at the moment

BlurFilter.name: BlurFilter
BlurFilter.description:
The BlurFilter applies a Gaussian blur to an object.
 The strength of the blur can be set for x- and y-axis separately (always relative to the stage).

ColorMatrixFilter.name: ColorMatrixFilter
ColorMatrixFilter.description:
The ColorMatrixFilter class lets you apply a 4x4 matrix transformation on the RGBA
 color and alpha values of every pixel on your displayObject to produce a result
 with a new set of RGBA color and alpha values. Its pretty powerful!

ColorStepFilter.name: ColorStepFilter
ColorStepFilter.description: This lowers the color depth of your image by the given amount, producing an image with a smaller palette.

DisplacementFilter.name: DisplacementFilter
DisplacementFilter.description:
The DisplacementFilter class uses the pixel values from the specified texture (called the displacement map) to perform a displacement of an object.
 You can use this filter to apply all manor of crazy warping effects
 Currently the r property of the texture is used offset the x and the g propery of the texture is used to offset the y.

params.name: texture
params.description: The texture used for the displacemtent map * must be power of 2 texture at the moment

DotScreenFilter.name: DotScreenFilter
DotScreenFilter.description: This filter applies a dotscreen effect making display objects appear to be made out of black and white halftone dots like an old printer

GrayFilter.name: GrayFilter
GrayFilter.description: This turns your displayObjects to black and white.

NormalMapFilter.name: NormalMapFilter
NormalMapFilter.description:
The NormalMapFilter class uses the pixel values from the specified texture (called the displacement map) to perform a displacement of an object. 
 You can use this filter to apply all manor of crazy warping effects
 Currently the r property of the texture is used offset the x and the g propery of the texture is used to offset the y.

params.name: texture
params.description: The texture used for the displacemtent map * must be power of 2 texture at the moment

PixelateFilter.name: PixelateFilter
PixelateFilter.description: This filter applies a pixelate effect making display objects appear 'blocky'

SepiaFilter.name: SepiaFilter
SepiaFilter.description: This applies a sepia effect to your displayObjects.

TwistFilter.name: TwistFilter
TwistFilter.description: This filter applies a twist effect making display objects appear twisted in the given direction

AssetLoader.name: AssetLoader
AssetLoader.description:
A Class that loads a bunch of images / sprite sheet / bitmap font files. Once the
assets have been loaded they are added to the PIXI Texture cache and can be accessed
easily through PIXI.Texture.fromImage() and PIXI.Sprite.fromImage()
When all items have been loaded this class will dispatch a 'onLoaded' event
As each individual item is loaded this class will dispatch a 'onProgress' event

params.name: assetURLs
params.description:
an array of image/sprite sheet urls that you would like loaded
     supported. Supported image formats include 'jpeg', 'jpg', 'png', 'gif'. Supported
     sprite sheet data formats only include 'JSON' at this time. Supported bitmap font
     data formats include 'xml' and 'fnt'.

params.name: crossorigin
params.description: Whether requests should be treated as crossorigin

AtlasLoader.name: AtlasLoader
AtlasLoader.description:
The atlas file loader is used to load in Atlas data and parse it
When loaded this class will dispatch a 'loaded' event
If loading fails this class will dispatch an 'error' event

params.name: url
params.description: the url of the JSON file

BitmapFontLoader.name: BitmapFontLoader
BitmapFontLoader.description:
The xml loader is used to load in XML bitmap font data ('xml' or 'fnt')
To generate the data you can use http://www.angelcode.com/products/bmfont/
This loader will also load the image file as the data.
When loaded this class will dispatch a 'loaded' event

params.name: url
params.description: The url of the sprite sheet JSON file

params.name: crossorigin
params.description: Whether requests should be treated as crossorigin

ImageLoader.name: ImageLoader
ImageLoader.description:
The image loader class is responsible for loading images file formats ('jpeg', 'jpg', 'png' and 'gif')
Once the image has been loaded it is stored in the PIXI texture cache and can be accessed though PIXI.Texture.fromFrameId() and PIXI.Sprite.fromFrameId()
When loaded this class will dispatch a 'loaded' event

params.name: url
params.description: The url of the image

params.name: crossorigin
params.description: Whether requests should be treated as crossorigin

JsonLoader.name: JsonLoader
JsonLoader.description:
The json file loader is used to load in JSON data and parse it
When loaded this class will dispatch a 'loaded' event
If loading fails this class will dispatch an 'error' event

params.name: url
params.description: The url of the JSON file

params.name: crossorigin
params.description: Whether requests should be treated as crossorigin

SpriteSheetLoader.name: SpriteSheetLoader
SpriteSheetLoader.description:
The sprite sheet loader is used to load in JSON sprite sheet data
To generate the data you can use http://www.codeandweb.com/texturepacker and publish in the 'JSON' format
There is a free version so thats nice, although the paid version is great value for money.
It is highly recommended to use Sprite sheets (also know as a 'texture atlas') as it means sprites can be batched and drawn together for highly increased rendering speed.
Once the data has been loaded the frames are stored in the PIXI texture cache and can be accessed though PIXI.Texture.fromFrameId() and PIXI.Sprite.fromFrameId()
This loader will load the image file that the Spritesheet points to as well as the data.
When loaded this class will dispatch a 'loaded' event

params.name: url
params.description: The url of the sprite sheet JSON file

params.name: crossorigin
params.description: Whether requests should be treated as crossorigin

Graphics.name: Graphics
Graphics.description:
The Graphics class contains a set of methods that you can use to create primitive shapes and lines.
It is important to know that with the webGL renderer only simple polygons can be filled at this stage
Complex polygons will not be filled. Heres an example of a complex polygon: http://www.goodboydigital.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/06/complexPolygon.png

CanvasMaskManager.name: CanvasMaskManager
CanvasMaskManager.description: A set of functions used to handle masking

CanvasGraphics.name: CanvasGraphics
CanvasGraphics.description: A set of functions used by the canvas renderer to draw the primitive graphics data

CanvasRenderer.name: CanvasRenderer
CanvasRenderer.description:
the CanvasRenderer draws the stage and all its content onto a 2d canvas. This renderer should be used for browsers that do not support webGL.
Dont forget to add the view to your DOM or you will not see anything :)

params.name: height=600

params.name: transparent
params.description: the transparency of the render view, default false

WebGLRenderer.name: WebGLRenderer
WebGLRenderer.description:
the WebGLRenderer draws the stage and all its content onto a webGL enabled canvas. This renderer
should be used for browsers that support webGL. This Render works by automatically managing webGLBatch's.
So no need for Sprite Batch's or Sprite Cloud's
Dont forget to add the view to your DOM or you will not see anything :)

params.name: width=0
params.description: the width of the canvas view

params.name: height=0
params.description: the height of the canvas view

params.name: view
params.description: the canvas to use as a view, optional

params.name: transparent=false
params.description: If the render view is transparent, default false

params.name: antialias=false
params.description: sets antialias (only applicable in chrome at the moment)

params.name: preserveDrawingBuffer=false
params.description: enables drawing buffer preservation, enable this if you need to call toDataUrl on the webgl context

BitmapText.name: BitmapText
BitmapText.description:
A Text Object will create a line(s) of text using bitmap font. To split a line you can use '\n', '\r' or '\r\n'
You can generate the fnt files using
http://www.angelcode.com/products/bmfont/ for windows or
http://www.bmglyph.com/ for mac.

params.name: text
params.description: The copy that you would like the text to display

params.name: style
params.description: The style parameters

props.name: font
props.description: The size (optional) and bitmap font id (required) eq 'Arial' or '20px Arial' (must have loaded previously)

props.name: align
props.description: Alignment for multiline text ('left', 'center' or 'right'), does not affect single line text

Text.name: Text
Text.description:
A Text Object will create a line(s) of text. To split a line you can use '\n' 
or add a wordWrap property set to true and and wordWrapWidth property with a value
in the style object

params.name: text
params.description: The copy that you would like the text to display

params.name: style
params.description: The style parameters

props.name: font
props.description: default 'bold 20px Arial' The style and size of the font

props.name: fill
props.description: A canvas fillstyle that will be used on the text e.g 'red', '#00FF00'

props.name: align
props.description: Alignment for multiline text ('left', 'center' or 'right'), does not affect single line text

props.name: stroke
props.description: A canvas fillstyle that will be used on the text stroke e.g 'blue', '#FCFF00'

props.name: strokeThickness
props.description: A number that represents the thickness of the stroke. Default is 0 (no stroke)

props.name: wordWrap
props.description: Indicates if word wrap should be used

props.name: wordWrapWidth
props.description: The width at which text will wrap, it needs wordWrap to be set to true

props.name: dropShadow
props.description: Set a drop shadow for the text

props.name: dropShadowColor
props.description: A fill style to be used on the dropshadow e.g 'red', '#00FF00'

props.name: dropShadowAngle
props.description: Set a angle of the drop shadow

props.name: dropShadowDistance
props.description: Set a distance of the drop shadow

BaseTexture.name: BaseTexture
BaseTexture.description: A texture stores the information that represents an image. All textures have a base texture

params.name: source
params.description: the source object (image or canvas)

params.name: scaleMode
params.description: Should be one of the PIXI.scaleMode consts

Texture.name: Texture
Texture.description:
A texture stores the information that represents an image or part of an image. It cannot be added
to the display list directly. To do this use PIXI.Sprite. If no frame is provided then the whole image is used

params.name: baseTexture
params.description: The base texture source to create the texture from

params.name: frame
params.description: The rectangle frame of the texture to show

autoDetectRenderer.name: autoDetectRenderer
autoDetectRenderer.description:
This helper function will automatically detect which renderer you should be using.
WebGL is the preferred renderer as it is a lot faster. If webGL is not supported by
the browser then this function will return a canvas renderer

params.name: width=800
params.description: the width of the renderers view

params.name: height=600
params.description: the height of the renderers view

params.name: view
params.description: the canvas to use as a view, optional

params.name: transparent
params.description: the transparency of the render view, default false

params.name: antialias
params.description: sets antialias (only applicable in webGL chrome at the moment)

getRecommendedRenderer.name: getRecommendedRenderer
getRecommendedRenderer.description:
This helper function will automatically detect which renderer you should be using.
This function is very similar to the autoDetectRenderer function except that is will return a canvas renderer for android.
Even thought both android chrome suports webGL the canvas implementation perform better at the time of writing. 
This function will likely change and update as webGL performance imporoves on thease devices.

params.name: width=800
params.description: the width of the renderers view

params.name: height=600
params.description: the height of the renderers view

params.name: view
params.description: the canvas to use as a view, optional

params.name: transparent
params.description: the transparency of the render view, default false

params.name: antialias
params.description: sets antialias (only applicable in webGL chrome at the moment)

InteractionManager.name: InteractionManager
InteractionManager.description:
The interaction manager deals with mouse and touch events. Any DisplayObject can be interactive
if its interactive parameter is set to true
This manager also supports multitouch.

params.name: stage

classitems.description:
Sets a mask for the displayObject. A mask is an object that limits the visibility of an object to the shape of the mask applied to it.
In PIXI a regular mask must be a PIXI.Graphics object. This allows for much faster masking in canvas as it utilises shape clipping.
To remove a mask, set this property to null.
